Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2014 09:42AM Carol99 wrote: great news ASB!! Quite a relief to not worry about your children's 50% chance!  I dread the day mine get tested.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2014 03:11PM Carol99 wrote: hi all, I'm new, I had my first of 4 AC on 12/27 but had some complications so my last one is 2/10.  I'm on the Dec. board also.  I see some of my Dec.. Sisters here:) I hate water too lately, it's making me gag.  Soda water is o.k. And Fresca. I have terrible chemo brain, my week of chemo I'm totally foggy.  No brain power for anything except Pinterest & TV.  I had a feeling of relief when I shaved my hair, I hated it falling out.  I hate my wig, I wear scarves & cute hats - I'm working & I get compliments on my hats:) I'm seeing a lot of young ladies here, I'm 45, I am BRAC 1+.  I have been in a genetic program at Dana Farber for a few years before my DX, thankfully, it was caught on MRI. I love all your posts but I just hate this, there is a you tube movie called Pink Ribbons, Inc. and a quote from it is "the biggest risk factor for Breast Cancer is being a woman".  It's seems so true with our span of ages & dx's. Good luck & wishing you all comfort! Carol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2014 04:47PM Carol99 wrote: I found losing my hair, when it was falling out, way more traumatic than after I shaved it.  It was everywhere. It was better after I made the decision to shave it.  Now I wear hats, scarves &.big earrings.  At home I wear comfy winter caps.

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2014 08:11PM Carol99 wrote: Jbok, great thread! I would say, don't push yourself, rest when you need to. Take the Ativan or whatever they give for anxiety & don't feel bad about it you won't get hooked! Stay hydrated through chemo, seltzer w/cranberry was my go to. It's scary, this is a great place for support
Posts.Title: A year after the diagnosis....Letter of Advice to Myself jbokland Carol99
